section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r N
o
28 1591

addressleaf.deletion:
May it please yo
r
good L. to be advertised
at there is fresh
addressleaf.section:
Belgia. 1591 28 Novem
b
To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. to be advertised
at there is freshe intelli-
gence come hither to the
Count of Hohenlo
,
at the
K. of Spaine
doth mak e newe levies in
Germany
both of horse and foote: of w
ch
there are 16 companies of horse, every company containinge 300 under
the conduct of Coronel
Slegel,
Schoonenberch,
Echenberch,
and
Simblemont,
who have eche
e commaundinge of 4 companies.
There are likewise two regiment
of footemen:
at make 30 Ensignes
of w
ch
the charge is equallye devided between
Duke Maurice
and
Coronel Bremen
. There are certaine Ambas-
sadors sent hither from the bishop of
Liege,
to negotiat a better
agreement between the bishop and their Contreis. For the Lande
of Liege,
Collen,
Munster
and
Westphalia,
w
ch
are held for
neutrall places, are greatly dammified by the frebutinge souldiers
of the states, w
t
out any benefit to the General cause. These
Ambassadors make report,
at for certaine the
Emperor
is resol-
ved to send unto her
Ma
tie
to the self same end, as to the
states,
to persuade her to a treatye. Howbeit there is annother come
lately to the Hage from
Cassimire,
but wether it be for the
Dukes affaires, or for his privat occasions, I cannot yet le
r
e.
His name is
Bassen,
who hath bin emploied by the Duke heere-
tofore in some buisines to her Ma
tie
. This party declareth that
e Princes of Germany that are Spanishe, give it out,
at
her Ma
tie
hath sent of purpose to the Emperor to induce him
to this Action of Intercession, between the Spaniard and
the
states. Albeit I knowe not further of it, then I signified
unto
you, yet I thought it not unmeete, to certifie w
at
is bruited.
